intro: Diplostephium violaceum var. puracense, commonly known as the Purple-veined Candelabra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking violet and green veined leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for ecological and botanical study.
